Stories like this is why a large section of UP will be thrilled to have Yogi Adityanath as CM.http://www.opindia.com/2017/03/why-a-hindu-sadhvi-in-delhi-is-forced-to-sell-her-temple/ …
Reverse the religions in the above story and I bet my life, you would have another 24x7 MSM hounding. But now, all we get is silence.
When one side goes too far, reaction from the other side too is extreme. Long term solution is to come to a middle point, acceptable to all
I cant claim to be a "core Hindu RW" but when I see such stories, I can try to understand from where the chants for Yogi as CM come from
Having said that, I hope Yogi Adityanath moves beyond religious politics and looks into holistic development and law & order issues
in their desire to counter one extreme, people often move to the other extreme. Ideally undesirable.

So if my Aadhar number & details are online in public, how does one misuse it without biometrics or OTPs? Genuine question
you can still do things without OTP. PIN can be easily known. Its not a personal effect. Need specific answer to Aadhar
but Aadhar is an otp system right. So does this option fail?
oh. So debate is whether biometrics can really be faked that easily. Cool
so using it as kyc is a problem. Cool
but can that be replicated to be used in an Aadhar system?
i was under impression they're stored in aadhar database directly. unless goi approved agency itself is a fraud

Some answers: Biometrics can be faked\stolen
Cell phone can be stolen
Aadhar can be used as KYC (this is an issue with PAN etc too actually)
where can this be accessed. And can it be faked from this theoretical access point effectively to use for authentication
i am actually asking how it can be misused. U just said the same thing in the answed
use for what. How is it different from a crook xerox guy using a xerox of pan?
internal threat. Exists with everything. Someone gets into ur PAN database etc. Was looking at Aadhar specific. @Chaitanya_13
completely irrelevant to discussion. Merits of aadhar is a different topic. I just want to know misuse opportunities
need specific answer not analogies or snarky comments. Thanks
isnt NPR scrapped? Anyways thats a different issue
so nothing short of hacking into a secure govt server?
nothing to do with authentication. Kyc fraud can be done with ration card also. Irrelevant
so answer is rogue govt? Cool. Was looking for something more realistic @Stupidosaur
i dont need respect or validation. Just need a technically feasible practical, specific answer.
should have worded ques better. This can be done by ur xerox bhaiyya also when u ask for a PAN xerox.
sure. Lets take that at face value. So the way to misuse would be hack into the govt servers. Cool
i can hack into any database even now and wreak havoc. If that were so easy. PAN, Ration card, Passport, so many
i have used aadhar for authentication. Kyc frauds are generic and not aadhar specific.
specific answer bhai. Ur good with ad hominems though
not sure but arent aadhar facilitation centres outsourced.? Thats a valid concern. But digi trans can be traced @slicesofIife
agree. But its a different issue
thats not really basic. Ur expecting a govt approved agency which can be traced using ip to go rogue. @slicesofIife
if that be the case even PAN or other agencies can go rogue any day they have ur id proofs & signs @slicesofIife
worse, in all other cases except aadhar, u wont be alerted of usage, nor can u trace with ip etc
its not about what info it has, its about how it can be misused. PAN etc can be the key to many things
so ur saying if I get access to aadhar, i will get access to a guys IT history on the IT site? LOL

The statements say:

2.96lk cr "in 3 years"
1.35lk cr in "last 3 Fin Yrs"
2.00 lk cr in "2 Fin yrs + 9 months"

All three can be truehttps://twitter.com/manupubby_ET/status/845208565438726145 …
I am just reading from the 3 statements you put up. All 3 have different specific time periods.
If your inference that the data is wrong, is solely from these statements, then your inference is not solid.
of course they overlap but in no way are the same period. Your tweets imply they are for the same period.
lol last 3yrs ≠ 3 FYs ≠ 2FYs + 9m. Defence budget is irrelevant to ur tweets which are based solely on these statements
Not casting any aspersions on @manupubby_ET . In this case, clearly the 3 periods are different. Not comparable.

AJ's Mar 17 quote of "3 yrs" could mean Mar 14 to Feb 17
MoS Mar 17 quote HAS to be of Apr 13 to Mar 16 (Since FY)

MoS cant give data of FY 16-17 in March 17 itself. 
These 2 periods have a gap of 1 yr odd. Still sticking to your argument?
Never seen any Fin data given for the on going financial year even when the financial year hasnt ended. But you insist thats happened. Coolhttps://twitter.com/manupubby_ET/status/845214687029575680 …
My only point @manupubby_ET is solely on the 3 pics u put up, cant conclude what you concluded, even though other data may show it
When they give quarterly total in say June, do they say "For 3 FYs this is our figure"??? Quarterly reports state the period
And u construe that 3 FYs as the ongoing FY which has seen only 3 months go by?
of course. My limited point is that arriving at such conclusions based on such vague data is misleading.
Also MoS said "LAST 3 Fin yrs". So ur saying in March, when the current FY is going on, he called it "last" FY?
completely diff point, also that statement speaks ONLY of capital expenditure. Not revenue exp.
Read all again. One statement speaks of "Capital procurement contracts". BTW we were referring to the other 2 statements
LOL are you someone who follows accounts? "Ordinarily" , in non-def sector "Purchase" is always revenue. @manupubby_ET
further, one of the 3 statements refers explicitly to "capital" rest are silent @manupubby_ET
Lol read that also. This is "Cap Exp" not "signing of contracts". HUGE difference.
Doesnt only 17/3/17 say "capital procurement contract"? The proc contract part i rest is silent.  @hachik012
Even if i go by ur version of 2 vs 1, it automatically makes 1 statement incomparable :)
Not all purchases = "assets", although not sure abt defence. But since the statements are silent, cant compare @manupubby_ET
If you buy spares it may well be procurement but wont be added to assets in normal accounting. @manupubby_ET
so coming back to my orig point, solely on those 3 screenshots, one cant conclude what @manupubby_ET concluded
I've punched multiple holes. None answered satisfactorily. I just hope this doesnt become a media report lol  @hachik012
Given Political ET's massive fall in credibility, I hope Defence ET stands firm  @hachik012
going in circles in absence of specific answers. 3 diff time periods and 2 diff wordings. @hachik012
At one point  u even mixed up Signing of contracts with expenditure lol.  @hachik012
I dont want to make any comments on your depth etc, Dont want to get personal @hachik012
But u made the assertions so u should back them up, not an expert. & "neither do I"? u already went personal LOL @hachik012
Anycase, I now hope this becomes an ET article. I know what to have for breakfast then :)  Cheers @hachik012
1st u got personal. 2nd u said you dont want to get personal. 3rd u admit u went personal. LOL WTH @hachik012
